text: __NOTOC__ Ludwig Kirschner (12 June 1904 – 11 February 1945) was a general in the Wehrmacht of Nazi Germany during World War II who commanded the 320. Volksgrenadier-Division. He was a recipient of the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves. Kirschner was killed on 11 February 1945 in Saybusch, Poland. ==Awards and decorations== * Iron Cross (1939) 2nd Class (31 December 1940) & 1st Class (14 September 1941)Thomas 1997, p. 366. * Honour Roll Clasp of the Army (8 February 1942) * Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves ** Knight's Cross on 18 January 1942 as Major and commander of the I./Infanterie-Regiment 436Fellgiebel 2000, pp. 257, 494. ** Oak Leaves on 28 October 1942 as Oberstleutnant and commander of Infanterie-Regiment 72Fellgiebel 2000, p. 55. ==References== ===Citations=== ===Bibliography=== * * Category:1904 births Category:1945 deaths Category:People from Bayreuth Category:People from the Kingdom of Bavaria Category:Major generals of the German Army (Wehrmacht) Category:Recipients of the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves Category:German military personnel killed in World War II
